flawed_nl_solution:
His utilities cost 1/2 the amount of his $250 car payment so his utilities cost 250/2 = $<<250/2=125>>125
All total, his bills cost him 775+250+125+50 = $<<775+250+125+50=1200>>1200
He makes $2500 a month and his bills cost $1200 a month so that leaves him with 2500-1200 = $<<2500-1200=13000>>13000
He wants to put half of $13000 into a retirement account so he will invest 13000/2= $<<13000/2=6500>>6500 into his retirement account
He had 13000 and puts $6500 into his retirement account so that leaves him with 13000-6500 = $<<13000-6500=6500>>6500 remaining
#### 6500

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1300, not 13000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
